speaker: Back Room
lines: A door that sticks for everyone else slides for the barkeep with two fingers.
The room smells like coin and the jokes money tells when it thinks it's alone.
A ledger sits open to a page with three names and three blanks.
One of the names is yours, if you want it to be.
A man with a scarf too clean to be honest fingers a dagger like a rosary.
'Courier job,' he says. 'Light. Heavy if you look at it.'
He puts a parcel on the table that tries to be heavier when you notice it.
The wall behind him is a bookcase that is taking a break from being a door.

choices.text: Refuse and ask who else is hiring.
Call him on the dagger and see who bleeds first.
